author: Staff Reporter
text:
The State government executed all schemes announced by it in the last 57 months and achieved cent per cent implementation of all schemes, said Finance Minister O. Panneerselvam.

Laying the foundation stone for underground drainage project and distributing gold for ‘mangalsutra’ to beneficiaries at function held at Palanichettipatti near here on Sunday, he said that most of the schemes would benefit not only the present generation but also future generation. Many innovative schemes done in the State were not implemented in any parts of the country, he said.

The main objective of several schemes was to uplift the poor and ensure them livelihood activities. More than eight lakh green houses were constructed in the State to provide shelter to the poor and to the downtrodden. Gold worth Rs.13.30 crore and marriage assistance of Rs.45.11 crore were given to 13,257 beneficiaries in the district so far, he added. Converting the function into a political platform, the Minister appealed to beneficiaries not to forget the good deeds of the government and support Chief Minister Jayalalithaa in future also.

Later, he inaugurated a park constructed at a cost of Rs.17 lakhs near Amma Kulam in Bodi town, and noon meal centre and high mast lights in 16 places in the town.

He also distributed gold worth Rs.2.10 crore to 421 beneficiaries, marriage assistance of Rs.57.25 lakh to 403 women in the function. Collector N. Venkatachalam accompanied him.
title: “State government has executed all schemes”
